column4: i think i've assigned my computer at least 10 ip's on the same interface on an internal network... is that bad?
and how do I get one of those ip's to show up in ifconfig?
(i'm used to gentoo where i would generally use whichever kernel version i like)
thats what I use on my laptop
and you can compile your own kernel on any linux distro
yeah
what do you need to know?
trying to connect to a device over usb by using a driver that makes it look like a network device
that makes no sense at all
sorry?
should just pop up as a usb drive or device
what is the device?
you might just be missing the ethernet over usb module

the faq says "    When plugged into a Windows XP host computer, an X server is automatically launched. This X server is configured to allow clients running on BlackDog to connect, thus allowing for access to the keyboard, video, and mouse functions. A similar process happens for Linux/x86, but requires some manual configuration for the USB device.
personally I wouldnt have bought that device since it lacks ethernet
yeah... but it works on the same princible
that device is junkware btw
no server should be without ethernet
it's not a server in that sense though
then what is it, a gimped out pda?
yeah i guess you could call it that
honestly, my dad kept badgering me to give him a birthday list, so i told him i wanted one of these to play around with
